ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 0; its a seminar
1 hour, hahaha
1 hour/week or less.
1 hour/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Good; it would have been nice to have more speakers.
Weaknesses: same kind of lecturer, boring
Strength is that we have different speakers covering vastly different fields in CDE. I love it. Lunch is also a great incentive.
What's relieving is no more pizza! But probably due to funding limit, the healthier food is insufficient. I always got hungry at like 3:00pm on seminar day.
Nice topic coverage.
I enjoyed listening to all the guest speakers! They were extremely passionate about their research topics!
Required lecture series. The speakers are usually interesting. The only weakness is when the speakers are not interesting.
Its strengths are that you can gauge additional research areas in CDE!

The course tried to bring in guest lectures who were interdisciplinary in the chronic disease department which I found a great help to understand how the department fit in the context of public health work. Would have liked to see more lectures on low-income chronic disease research, but otherwise no complaints about the course.
Poor speakers. Find speakers who reflect student interests.
You could have people who only have an MPH in CDE or SBS tell us about their career path. While many people do want to do a PhD, there are a considerable number of students just here for their MPH.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Nicola Hawley  Dr. Hawley is fantastic. She is responsive, engaging, and approachable.
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  a
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  Nicky is a great moderator for the seminars.
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  Good organizer for guest lecturers and this course.
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  Great! Nothing negative to say. She works very hard to bring in interesting and relevant speakers.
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  She introduced interesting speakers!
Instructor: Nicola Hawley  Nice person

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great, also seminar is required so no really an option.
Boring
Overall, I do recommend this to the new students.
Personally I'm not interested in most topics
Good seminar course. Will recommend it to fellow students.
The guest speakers presented their research well and their enthusiasm is infectious!
A fun lecture series. It is required, but they give you food so all is well.
It was pretty informative!

Overall, a great seminar with interesting lectures. Despite it being a required course, the lectures were extremely interested and I felt I would have attended the talks out of my own personal interests.
I really dont believe it is all that necessary, but if the seminar continues then students should have some input in the speakers or their topics of discussion.
